intro: Dalea longipila, commonly known as the longpod milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its flowers are usually pink to purple, and it produces elongated, cylindrical seed pods. Dalea longipila is adapted to drought conditions and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
